intro: Polypodium vulgare var. auritum, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a variant of the common shield fern. It is a perennial evergreen fern native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features fronds that are typically leathery and covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and rocky areas. The fronds are bipinnate, with small, rounded pinnae that contribute to its ornamental value in gardens.
